com.google.enterprise.connector.util
Class Base64

java.lang.Object
  com.google.enterprise.connector.util.Base64

public class Base64
extends java.lang.Object

Base64 converter class. This code is not a full-blown MIME encoder; it simply converts binary data to Base64 data and back.

Since:
2.8

          The 64 valid Base64 encoding characters.

Method Detail

encode

public static java.lang.String encode(byte[] source)
Encodes a byte array into Base64 notation. Equivalent to calling encodeBytes(source, 0, source.length)

Parameters:
source - the binary data to encode
Returns:
the Base64-encoded output String

encodeWebSafe

public static java.lang.String encodeWebSafe(byte[] source,
                                             boolean doPadding)
Encodes a byte array into web safe Base64 notation.

Parameters:
source - the binary data to encode
doPadding - If true, pad the result with '=' chars if it does not fall on 3 byte boundaries.
Returns:
the Base64-encoded output String

encode

public static java.lang.String encode(byte[] source,
                                      int off,
                                      int len,
                                      byte[] alphabet,
                                      boolean doPadding)
Encodes a byte array into Base64 notation.

Parameters:
source - the binary data to encode
off - offset in array where conversion should begin
len - length of data to convert
alphabet - the encoding alphabet
doPadding - If true, pad the result with '=' chars if it does not fall on 3 byte boundaries.
Returns:
the Base64-encoded output String

encode

public static byte[] encode(byte[] source,
                            int off,
                            int len,
                            byte[] alphabet,
                            int maxLineLength)
Encodes a byte array into Base64 notation.

Parameters:
source - the data to convert
off - offset in array where conversion should begin
len - length of data to convert
alphabet - the encoding alphabet
maxLineLength - the maximum length of each line of output
Returns:
a byte array containing the Base64-encoded output

decode

public static byte[] decode(java.lang.String source)
                     throws Base64DecoderException
Decodes data from Base64 notation. Understands either standard or web-safe encoding.

Parameters:
source - the Base64-encoded String to decode
Returns:
a byte array containing the decoded data
Throws:
Base64DecoderException - if the source does not contain valid Base64-encoded data

decode

public static byte[] decode(byte[] source)
                     throws Base64DecoderException
Decodes Base64 content in byte array format and returns the decoded byte array. Understands either standard or web-safe encoding.

Parameters:
source - the Base64-encoded data to decode
Returns:
a byte array containing the decoded data
Throws:
Base64DecoderException - if the source does not contain valid Base64-encoded data

decode

public static byte[] decode(byte[] source,
                            int off,
                            int len)
                     throws Base64DecoderException
Decodes Base64 content in byte array format and returns the decoded byte array. Understands either standard or web-safe encoding.

Parameters:
source - the Base64-encoded data to decode
off - the offset into source to begin decoding
len - the number of characters to decode
Returns:
a byte array containing the decoded data
Throws:
Base64DecoderException - if the source does not contain valid Base64-encoded data
